reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Gain momentum in reducing TB/ HIV burden in Ukraine

description.narrative: Ukraine - TB/HIV - State Institution "Public Health Center of the Ministry of Health of Ukraine" - PHC Ukraine. This program has the following goals: To sustain effective TB responses in Ukraine through implementation of evidence-based people-centered approaches, with special emphases on management of drug-resistant TB and key population groups at risk.. To sustain effective HIV response in Ukraine through implementation of evidence-based people-centered approaches, with special emphases on key population groups at risk.. To ensure overall coordination and complementarity of activities and programs and a proper mechanism for stakeholder involvement in discussion and decision-making, sustainable funding of the related programs and activities, improve service organization and delivery, improve data quality for activity planning, continuously build human resource capacity and maintain high standards in the field of education and science, using human rights and gender-sensitive approaches and removing barriers.. The objectives of this program are: Ensure universal access to timely and quality TB case detection and diagnosis of DR-TB by rolling out rapid molecular testing, improving quality and coverage of DST and targeted active case finding in key populations. Improve outcomes of DR-TB patients by implementing modified shorter treatment regimens and scaling up people-centered approaches with comprehensive adherence support. Reduce TB transmission by scaling up effective preventive treatment and improving infection control. Enable conducive health system environment and effective management of the National TB Program. Reduce HIV transmission by expanding coverage of innovative prevention interventions in key populations and eliminating MTCT. Improve 90-90-90 cascade by promoting innovative testing approaches, increasing early HIV detection, early ART initiation, improving quality of care by, ensuring access to quality assured ARVs and treatment monitoring, and implementing differentiated people-centered models of care. Enable conducive health system environment and effective management of the National HIV Response. Leverage ongoing health delivery and health financing reform to accelerate adoption of patient-centered approaches, integration of service provision, improve strategic purchasing of TB and HIV services, ensure institutionalization of mechanisms for procurement, human resources for health and improve data systems and available strategic information. Empower people living with, at risk of and affected by HIV and ensure community-led TB and HIV responses through community based monitoring, social mobilization and community linkages and coordination. Remove human rights and gender barriers and achieve zero discrimination towards people with TB and HIV and representatives of key and vulnerable groups

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for UKR-C-PHC
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
KP - Other 1: Number and percentage of PWIDs on substitution therapy
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Number of cases of XDR TB enrolled on treatment
Percentage of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months
Percentage of people living with HIV newly initiated on ART who were screened for TB
Percentage of new HIV-positive patients starting IPT during the reporting period
Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of TB patients with DST result for at least Rifampicin among the total number of notified (new and retreatment) cases in the same year
Percentage of MSM reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Number of TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB notified
Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
KP Other 2: Proportion of HIV-positive PWID who are registered (enrolled in care) at AIDS centers in the reporting period
Percentage of new and relapse TB patients tested using WHO recommended rapid tests at the time of diagnosis
TCS Other-1: Number of adults currently receiving antiretroviral therapy among all adults and children living with HIV in penitentiary system
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
KP-Other 2: Number of eligible people who initiated oral antiretroviral PrEP during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
MDR-TB - Other 1 Number of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases covered with comprehensive psychosocial support
TCS - Other 2: Percentage of HIV positive PWID linked to HIV care
Percentage of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB started on treatment for MDR-TB who were lost to follow up during the first six months of treatment
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
TCS - Other 1: Number of PLWH reached with community-based care and support
Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
TCS Other-2: Number of PLWH adults reached with community-based care and support services
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of confirmed RR/MDR-TB cases tested for resistance to second-line drugs
Percentage of people who inject drugs that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
Percentage of MSM that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving DST (bacteriologically positive cases only)
KP-Other-1: Number and % of IDUs on substitution maintenance therapy
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
KP Other-1: Number and percentage of PWIDs on substitution maintenance therapy
Percentage of PLHIV on ART who initiated TB preventive therapy among those eligible during the reporting period
KP Other-2: Proportion of HIV-positive PWID who are registered (enrolled in care) at AIDS centers in the reporting period
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - individual and/or smaller group level interventions
Percentage of eligible men who have sex with men who initiated oral antiretroviral PrEP during the reporting period
